duties_responsibilities.duty: Work with multidisciplinary team members to provide the very best care for patients in a Magnet®- designated hospital.
Continually strive to improve the patient experience and promote a collaborative environment.
Attend ALL classes and follow the schedule of assigned preceptors throughout the entire clinical rotation of the residency program.
Maintain a full-time, 36 hours per week schedule throughout the first year of the residency program.

education_certification.credential: Graduate from an accredited school of nursing; BSN preferred.
Current American Heart Association Healthcare Provider Basic Life Support certification.
Current license to practice professional nursing in the state of Texas by beginning of the residency.
Residency is open to new graduates or experienced RNs with less than one year experience or seeking to enter acute care for the first time.
